transcript_segments.text: Hi guys, welcome back to our channel, Sauté at Site. Today, we’re going to make the famous Talassery Chicken Biryani. This is an easy one-pot recipe without the hassle of layering or extra steps. So let's get started! First, we’ll prepare the biryani masala using common household spices.
I’ve taken 1½ tsp fennel seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 pieces of star anise, 1 cinnamon stick, 8–10 peppercorns, 4 cloves, and 4 green cardamoms. I’ll add them to a pan and dry roast until aromatic.

The masala is now fragrant. I’ll let it cool and grind it into a fine powder. Next, we pre-cook the rice. I’ve taken water in a deep vessel and added 1 tbsp ghee along with whole spices — cardamom, cloves, pepper, star anise, cinnamon,
and fennel seeds. Add them to the water. These spices will infuse great flavor into the rice. Give it a stir and add salt to taste.

Bring the water to a boil before adding the rice for best results. I’ve taken 2 cups of Jeerakasala rice, also called Kaima rice — traditionally used for Talassery biryani. If you don’t have it, you can use basmati rice, but soak it for 30 minutes. I’ve also taken 1 kg chicken, marinated with ¾ tsp turmeric, salt, lemon juice, and 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste.
Let the chicken marinate for about an hour. Now that the water is boiling, it’s time to add the rice.
Stir the rice well. Cook until it’s al dente — about 75% done. It shouldn’t take more than 10–12 minutes. This is the perfect texture. Turn off the heat, strain the rice using a colander,
